bestBHT.bht: Nymphas, one of the Laodicean brethren, was likely a man who opened their house for the church to meet. In the early years of Christianity, believers often gathered in homes for worship and fellowship. This highlights the idea that households could serve as little Churches, where families could be trained in the fear of the Lord and resemble a community of faith. Nymphas' role underscores the importance of creating a godly atmosphere within our own homes and living out our faith as a witness to others.
